data.text: A communal toilet of a type often used in a camp or barracks.
data.attributionText: from The American HeritageÂ® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A privy; a water-closet; especially, a water-closet in a public place, as in factories, schools, barracks, hospitals, etc.
A privy, or water-closet, esp. in a camp, hospital, etc.
data.attributionText: from the GNU version of the Collaborative International Dictionary of English.

data.text: a very simple <xref>toilet</xref> <xref>facility</xref>, usually just a <xref>pit</xref> or <xref>trench</xref>. See also the <xref>slang</xref> terms <xref>john</xref> and <xref>johnny house</xref>.

data.text: a public toilet in a military area
